meanings.definition: A function from a mathematical object to itself.
meanings.sent1: The endomorphism of the circle maps the shape back onto itself.
meanings.sent2: In mathematics, an endomorphism is a function that operates within the same mathematical object.
meanings.sent3: The endomorphism of the mirror made it reflect its own reflection!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an endomorphism, constantly feeding back into itself for new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The endomorphism of the maze led the explorer right back to the starting point.

meanings.definition: A linear transformation from a vector space to itself.
meanings.sent1: The endomorphism of the plane rotates the vectors within the same space.
meanings.sent2: Linear algebra deals with endomorphisms that transform a vector space onto itself.
meanings.sent3: The endomorphism of the rubber band twisted it into a knot all by itself!
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was like an endomorphism, reshaping the team dynamics from within.
meanings.sent5: The endomorphism of the river looped back on itself, creating a natural cycle.
